name: Hardest The Great Lakes Initiative Trivia Quiz | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who leads the Great Lakes Initiative?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Immortal

	Mr. Immortal is a mutant who cannot die. He has tried many times, and others have been successful many times, but he simply cannot die. He claims that it is his destiny to be the last living person on Earth, which is certainly a lonely fate.

questions.text: Flatman's alter ego is Doctor Val Ventura. What is Ventura a doctor of?
questions.explanation:
Stuff.

	When Doorman asks what he is a doctor of, Ventura replies "stuff". He cannot present his medical degree and seems to have extensive knowledge only in the field of fashion. Flatman has stretching abilities, and is two-dimensional.

questions.text: A young man with the alias of Grasshopper joined the team. How long did he survive with the GLI?
questions.explanation:
5.8 seconds

	Recruited to help the team fight Maelstrom, Grasshopper was behind Doorman when Zaran threw a sai at him. Doorman used his teleportation powers to let the weapon pass through him, and the sai buried itself deep in Grasshopper's head.

True.

	Doorman is a living portal, similar to Cloak or Gateway. He is a mutant, and has served as an angel of Death, a fact of which his father is very proud.

Leather Boy.

	Leather Boy answered the classified ad for 'costumed adventurers', but left the group soon afterward due to the misunderstanding. Leather Boy, as the name implies, was looking for different sorts of adventure.

questions.text: Squirrel Girl used her unique powers to defeat Doctor Doom.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Using her underwhelming ability to communicate with squirrels, Squirrel Girl swarmed the armed tyrant with the rodents, leading to his defeat and capitulation.

questions.text: Which team member did NOT die in "GLA: Misassembled"?
questions.explanation:
Big Bertha.

	Dinah Soar died in battle with Maelstrom, sending Mr. Immortal into a deep depression. Doorman was resurrected, as many superheroes are, and Mr. Immortal died in nearly every issue, but he simply comes back to life. Big Bertha, the model who can alter her weight, did not die.

questions.text: Who convinced Maelstrom to kill himself?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Immortal

	Mr. Immortal convinced Maelstrom that being the only person in the universe left alive would be a terribly lonely fate. The answer, he claimed, lay in death. Mr. Immortal then shot himself in the head, which he of course soon recovered from, but Maelstrom was not so lucky.

questions.text: In "GLX-Mas", whose body becomes a shooting star?
questions.explanation:
Grasshopper II's body.

	Grasshopper II tested out the Maximum Jump function on his suit. It catapaulted him into outer space, where he suffocated and died. His body later became a shooting star that was enjoyed by the entire team.

questions.text: Who beats the Thing at poker?
questions.explanation:
Flatman.

	After winning, the team decides to call themselves the Great Lakes Champions. This is just one of their many team names.
